sect1.title: Psmisc-&psmisc-version;
sect1.para: The Psmisc package contains programs for displaying information on processes.
Psmisc installation depends on: Bash, Binutils, Coreutils, Diffutils, GCC, Gettext, Glibc, Grep, Make, Ncurses, Sed.

sect2.title: Installation of Psmisc
sect2.para: The meaning of the configure option:

listitem.para: --exec-prefix=/: This causes the binaries to be installed in /bin instead of /usr/bin. As the Psmisc programs are often used in bootscripts, they should be available also when the /usr file system isn't mounted.

sect2.para: There is no reason for the pstree and pstree.x11 programs to reside in /bin. We therefore move them to /usr/bin. Also, there is no need for pstree.x11 to exist as a separate program. We therefore make it a symbolic link to pstree:

By default Psmisc's pidof program isn't installed. Generally, this isn't a problem because we later install the Sysvinit package, which provides a better pidof program. But if you're not going to use Sysvinit, you should complete the installation of Psmisc by creating the following symlink:

sect2.title: Contents of Psmisc
sect2.para: Installed programs: fuser, killall, pstree and pstree.x11 (link to pstree)

sect2.title: Short descriptions
sect2.para: fuser reports the PIDs of processes that use the given files or file systems.
killall kills processes by name. It sends a signal to all processes running any of the given commands.
pstree displays running processes as a tree.
pstree.x11 same as pstree except that it waits for confirmation before exiting.
